references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces CLIP, a vision-language model that is foundational to many of the zero-shot and few-shot anomaly detection methods, including those compared in this paper.

references.paper_title: MVTec-AD: A comprehensive real-world dataset for unsupervised anomaly detection
references.reason: This paper introduces the widely used MVTec-AD dataset, which is one of the primary benchmarks used to evaluate the performance of anomaly detection methods in this paper.

references.paper_title: PaDiM: a patch distribution modeling framework for anomaly detection and localization
references.reason: This paper introduces PaDiM, a patch-based anomaly detection method that is a strong competitor and is frequently compared against in this paper.

references.paper_title: A unified model for multi-class anomaly detection
references.reason: This paper introduces UniAD, a full-shot anomaly detection method that this paper's method outperforms; therefore, it serves as a strong baseline for comparison.

references.paper_title: Towards total recall in industrial anomaly detection
references.reason: This paper introduces PatchCore, a memory-based anomaly detection method that is compared to and contrasted against the proposed MetaUAS method in this paper.
